packets.parameters

Class CmdParam

  • java.lang.Object
    • packets.parameters.CmdParam

  • public final class CmdParam
extends java.lang.Object
    FULLY DOCUMENTED. This is used to defined a command parameter. This contains all the information about a parameter needed to both display it in the GUI and read/write CCSDS packets.
    Author:
    Joe Benassi, David McComas

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Constructor: creates a CmdParam with the input attributes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CmdParam

        public CmdParam(CmdParam.ParamType Type,
        java.lang.String Name,
        boolean isInputParam,
        ChoiceOption[] choiceOptions,
        int NumBytes)
        Constructor: creates a CmdParam with the input attributes.
        Parameters:
        Type - The parameter type (int, string, spare, or spare).
        Name - The name to display in the GUI.
        isInputParam - If the user has to manually type in the parameter.
        choiceOptions - If this is not an InputParameter, the different choices available to the user.
        NumBytes - The amount of bytes that all the parameters will occupy in the command packet.

    • Method Detail

      • getSpare

        public static final CmdParam getSpare(java.lang.String type)
        Returns a CmdParam that is invisible to the GUI and contributes only values of zero to the command packet.
        Parameters:
        type - The type. For example, uint8, int16. This is only used to determine the size of the spare.
        Returns:
        A CmdPaam that is a spare.

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the String representing this perameter's name.
        Returns:
        This parameter's name.

      • getType

        public final CmdParam.ParamType getType()
        Returns the type of this parameter.
        Returns:
        the ParamType of this.

      • loadByteArray

        public final void loadByteArray()
        Updates the byte array for this parameter based on the value more recently assigned to it. Uses the knowledge of this being an integer, string, or spare parameter to pack and adjust for endianness accordingly.

      • getByteArray

        public final byte[] getByteArray()
        Returns the byte array. Returns the array that will be pasted in the final command packet. In the packet, it will be together and in its original order.
        Returns:
        The byte array representing the value of this parameter.

      • setValue

        public final void setValue(java.lang.String value)
        Sets the value of this parameter to the input value and updates the byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to set as this parameter's value.

      • getNumBytes

        public final int getNumBytes()
        Returns the number of bytes that this command parameter occupies in the final packet.
        Returns:
        The byte length of this paramter.

      • isInputParam

        public final boolean isInputParam()
        Returns true if this parameter is an input parameter. Otherwise, it is a choiceparameter, and returns false.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this is an input parameter.

      • getChoiceOptions

        public final ChoiceOption[] getChoiceOptions()
        Returns the ChoiceOptions for this command parameter.
        Returns:
        The ChoiceOptions available for this.
